table.caption: Environmental Hazards
rows: The airship experiences rough turbulence. Each creature aboard the ship must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for {@dice 1d4} hours due to motion sickness.

The airship travels at extreme altitudes for {@dice 1d4} hours. During this time, the ship is in an area of extreme cold (see "{@hazard Extreme Cold|XDMG|Environmental Effects}" in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|XDMG}) and reduced gravity: creatures' and objects' weights are halved, and creatures' High Jump and Long Jump distances are doubled.

The airship passes through a lightning storm, which takes {@dice 1d4} hours. During this time, the area around the ship is {@variantrule Heavily Obscured|XPHB}, and any creature that starts its turn on the ship's deck must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be struck by lightning and take 4 ({@dice 1d8}) Lightning damage.

The airship enters an area of strong wind (see "{@hazard Strong Wind|XDMG|Environmental Effects}" in the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|XDMG}), which lasts for {@dice 1d4} hours. When the ship first enters this area, the crew member operating the ship's Helm must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or the ship inverts.
